CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Market Release stage positioned above or below the Design Phase stage?
SRP.A: The Market Release stage is positioned {below} the Design Phase stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Design Phase?
VE.A: The value of stage Design Phase is {88%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Production?
VE.A: The value of stage Production is {40%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Prototype Development?
VE.A: The value of stage Prototype Development is {76%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Project Initiation, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Market Release, with a value of {29%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Project Initiation to stage Design Phase?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Project Initiation to stage Design Phase is {12%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 70%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Project Initiation} stage has {100%}, the {Design Phase} stage has {88%}, the {Prototype Development} stage has {76%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 58%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Final Design Approval} stage has {52%}, the {Production} stage has {40%}, the {Market Release} stage has {29%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 58% and 70%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Project Initiation to Design Phase, or from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Project Initiation} to {Design Phase} is equal to the reduction from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development, or from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Design Phase} to {Prototype Development} is equal to the reduction from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Design Phase to Prototype Development, from stage Prototype Development to Testing and Validation, or from stage Final Design Approval to Production?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Design Phase} to {Prototype Development}, {Prototype Development} to {Testing and Validation}, and {Final Design Approval} to {Production} are equal.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Production to Market Release, from stage Project Initiation to Design Phase, or from stage Testing and Validation to Final Design Approval?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {Production} to {Market Release}, {Project Initiation} to {Design Phase}, and {Testing and Validation} to {Final Design Approval} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Project Initiation} and {Design Phase} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Production} and {Market Release} stages.
